<reasoning>
Step 1: Analysing the input data containing 3 interview transcripts.
Step 2: Identifying common themes across participants: CLI preference, documentation frustration, desire for tool consolidation.
Step 3: Segmenting users based on roles and experience levels.
Step 4: Synthesising persona attributes from aggregated insights.
</reasoning>

<output>
{
  "personas": [
    {
      "id": "persona-001",
      "name": "Alex Chen",
      "demographics": {
        "age_range": "25-34",
        "occupation": "Software Developer",
        "experience_level": "Mid-level",
        "location": "Urban tech hub"
      },
      "goals": [
        "Streamline daily workflow with efficient tools",
        "Stay current with technology best practices",
        "Reduce context switching between applications"
      ],
      "pain_points": [
        "Outdated documentation wastes valuable time",
        "Too many tools required for basic tasks",
        "Inconsistent experiences across platforms"
      ],
      "behaviours": [
        "Prefers keyboard shortcuts and CLI over GUI",
        "Reads documentation before trying new tools",
        "Automates repetitive tasks whenever possible"
      ],
      "quotes": [
        "I just want things to work without friction.",
        "Good documentation is worth its weight in gold."
      ]
    }
  ]
}
</output>
